reviewText: Too rough to watch. I like the actor Tenoch Huerta.
OUTSTANDING CINEMATOGRAPHY. Mexico is turning out some of the best films in the world. If you dig this, check out the Thin Yellow Line. Both cinematic gold. Bravo.
This is, to me, a perfect movie.  Pure cinema, pure heart.

Not since "Pulp Fiction" have I been so excited about seeing a film that was nothing like any other film I had seen before with so much innovation and yet it was accessible and entertaining. Shot in black & white in a 4:3 aspect ratio (less wide screen like a square), with unconventional camera moves, it all sounds super pretentious and I thought would be distracting and or annoying but it was not at all! Talk about artistic courage also. "The Revenant" was my favorite film last year and so was this, Mexican filmmakers are kicking butt!
One of the best films of the year. Charming. Funny and full of heart.
this is good movie, with new actors which enhace.
Terrific, smart, poignant film; a road movie but mostly about DF, about youth, nihilism, idealism, and family.  One of the best movies I've seen this year [and I watch a tremendous amount of movies].
